page.title: 07COUNTRY PARK-DOWNSBANKS(1)
page.content: Today this is an area of natural beauty,owned by the National Trust with free access to the public. A stream runs through a valley.On one side it is steep and covered with fern ,gradually widening to windswept grass, gorse and trees. The other side starts marshy with reeds,marsh marigolds,moss,orchis, watercress and others growing. The marsh gradually gives way to firmer, grassy ground, quite pleasant for picnics. It is a popular open space for the people of Stoke On Trent to the North and Stone to the South. It is well used for horse-riding walking and jogging.
